content: Try clicking the view button and see who is issuing the certificate. My guess is your antivirus and you need to follow their instructions to compromise your chain of trust so they can hack your encrypted connection to the mail server and scan mail. But as I said, it is a guess.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Hola, Las versiones portables no son oficiales. El Thunderbird 127 era una versión Beta actualmente esta en la versión 128, pero según el calendario de release de Thunderbird la versión 127 no se lanzara como estable, en su lugar será la versión 128 ESR: https://blog.thunderbird.net/2024/06/may-2024-community-office-hours-the-thunderbird-release-process/

Si se ha resuelto la consulta agradeceríamos marcar como solucionada para que sirva a otros usuarios. ¡Gracias!
creator: pcp04

content: How is the crash behavior different from a freeze?
creator: wsmwk

content:
After the crash Thunderbird is not running annymore. There is no active process after a crash. During a freeze Thunderbird is not responsive.

Sometime Thunderbird recovers from a freeze and sometimes it crashes and stops the process.
creator: thea.

content:
What are your crash IDs? https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-crashes

They will be listed at help > Troubleshooting information

content: I somehow fixed it, not sure what exactly helped but I cleaned up my friend's PC. Deleted 4 different anti-virus software and a bunch of other stuff and the sending buttons became enabled later on again.

content:
Menu entries are context sensitive. So this image shows all of the mail menu items disabled because there is no mail showing, it is in a settings environment.

This image

appears to lack a toolbar, so right click on a blank space in the menu bar and turn it on.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Well vote for it in Bugzilla if you have found the bug. That is the canonical source of the status on things. This is not a support issue and the posting here is actually off topic in this forum.

If you have Ideas or Feedback, I suggest you use the link on the help menu in Thunderbird that will direct you here https://connect.mozilla.org/

content: Issue resolved. A unknown system service was occupying port 80 and caused the auth flow to fail at the last step. Killing that service solved the issue.
